newsArticles.title: OpenAI in Talks to Raise New Funding at $100 Billion Valuation (Bloomberg)
newsArticles.summary: OpenAI, the research group behind the powerful ChatGPT chatbot, is in talks to raise new funding at a valuation of $100 billion, according to Bloomberg. This would make it one of the most valuable AI companies in the world.

newsArticles.title: Facebook's Meta Fined for Breaches of Italian Gambling Ads Ban (Reuters)
newsArticles.summary: Meta, the parent company of Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp, has been fined â‚¬20 million by Italian authorities for violating the country's ban on gambling advertising. The fine relates to targeted ads for online gambling companies that were shown to users in Italy.

newsArticles.title: US Government's Proposal to Boost EV Sales is Challenging but Not Impossible (CNN)
newsArticles.summary: The Biden administration has proposed a new set of tax incentives and regulations aimed at boosting electric vehicle (EV) sales in the United States. The proposal faces an uphill battle in Congress, but experts say it could still have a significant impact on the EV market.

newsArticles.title: Microsoft's Copilot Rises From the Ashes of Bob and Clippy (TechNewsWorld)
newsArticles.summary: Microsoft's new Copilot feature for its Visual Studio Code editor is being praised for its ability to help developers write code more efficiently. Copilot builds on the legacy of previous Microsoft AI assistants like Bob and Clippy, but it is far more powerful and versatile.

newsArticles.title: India Boosts AI in Weather Forecasts as Floods and Droughts Increase (Reuters)
newsArticles.summary: India is turning to artificial intelligence (AI) to improve its weather forecasting capabilities in the wake of increasingly frequent floods and droughts. The Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Delhi is developing a new AI-powered weather model that will be used to provide more accurate and timely forecasts.

latestNews.title: Salesforce Escaped from the Jaws of Activists to Find Stability in 2023 (TechCrunch)
latestNews.summary: After years of turmoil, Salesforce has emerged as a stronger company in 2023. The cloud computing giant has weathered a storm of activist investor pressure and executive turnover, and it is now well-positioned for continued growth in the years to come.
